Package behaviours

Functionality for agents is composed of combinations of several Behaviours.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ReceiveConnectRequest
    Responds to Connect Requests from other peers with either yes or no - if yes, add them to a list of peers connected to the Super Peer
    ReceiveConnectResponse
    Connect Request reply from a Super Peer.
    ReceiveFileList
    Add a peers shared file list to this super peer's file index.
    ReceiveFileRequest
    Responds by sending the file back.
    ReceiveFileResponse
    Completes the process of acquiring files - the peer at this point has a file.
    ReceiveNeighborsResponse
    Adds to knownPeers the response from the Host Cache
    ReceiveNeighboursRequest
    The Host Cache continually waits for a REQUEST_NEIGHBOURS message.
    ReceiveNetworkStats
    Runner receives stats package from peers and adds the data to the stats collections
    ReceiveSearchRequest
    Search requests are either responded to directly (if we have the file) or forwarded using document routing.
    ReceiveSearchResponse
    Receives a Search Response message, and responds in one of several ways.
    ReportBehaviour
    Print some information every interval about the state of the network.
    SendConnectRequest
    Asks a Super Peer to connect.
    SendFileList
    Ordinary peers send a file list when they join the network, and thereafter whenever their sharedFiled list changes
    SendNeighboursRequest
    When peers join the network (or need more contactable neighbours), they request Super Peer addresses from the Host Cache.
    SendSearchRequest
    Searches for file.

Package behaviours Description

Functionality for agents is composed of combinations of several Behaviours.
